__e: I'm not good at this, but if you want to talk...
If you're not suited to your job, why not hand it over to someone who'd do it better?
I mean, God damn it, you haven't spent five minutes with me and now you're telling me I'm wrong for the part?
It's the only life I'm any good for now, and it looks like it's the only life you've ever known
No, I know it's a good thing to do, it's just not really, like, a very "me" thing to do.
I tried it once for about a month, but so not me.

I just want to say that, like, I know maybe I'm not the best fit for you or for this country or for your family, but I love you and that... like, that should mean something, - that should be enough, right?
You be a man, you do the right thing, you find the right girl and you treat her the right way?
Is I am so much better for you than she is.
I'm sorry, but I'm still not sure you're the right fit.
No, I know it's a good thing to do, it's just not really, like, a very "me" thing to do.
I'm kind of nowhere at the moment, which is really scary, but not your fault.
Well, she wanted to know if PS 27 would be a good fit for her two boys.
Huh. I don't think this house is kid-friendly.
It's a beautiful house. But I'm just not sure how kid-friendly it is, and we have two small children.
Look, I came out here knowing I needed to find a school that'd be good for the girls. But what school exists for kids like ours? I mean, siphon witches?
You're obviously a clever and resilient woman to survive out here as long as you have, and you've built an impressive network.
He fits your description of the killer, but... you never saw him,... ..you never met him.
'He says she's more than up to the job.'
I have loved seeing you these last few days, but I can't see the whole having-a-son thing fitting in with my lifestyle.
Yeah, I just don't think you're right for the job.
It's just not good enough to say... she doesn't look the part.
Yes, of course. I always say dress the part, or in this case, the situation.
That's not an answer to the question that I asked.
